newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks drive higher, NYSE sets curbs.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks drive higher, NYSE sets curbs.

text.p: U.S. stocks marched higher in late morning trade on Wednesday, posting solid gains as bond yields fell from recent highs and as technology stocks continued their upward drive.
The Dow Jones Industrial average was up 61 points at 8249, after the New York Stock Exchange set curbs on index-arbitrage trading at 1114 EDT/1514 GMT.
The Nasdaq composite, a recent source of market leadership, added nine points or 0.54 percent to 1635.
The long bond gained 8/32 to yield 6.47 percent.
Among technology stocks, Apple Computer Inc soared 7-9/16 to 27-5/16 after Microsoft Corp said it would invest $150 million in non-voting Apple stock.
The long bond firmed ahead of a closely-watched $12 billion Treasury auction of 10-year notes, and the release of the Federal Reserve's Beige Book at 1400 EDT/1800 GMT.
